pullRequest.title: [RW-4888][risk=no] Add helptext to notebooks
pullRequest.bodyText:
This text is now on both the notebook preview page and the actual notebook page.


PR checklist

 This PR meets the Acceptance Criteria in the JIRA story
 The JIRA story has been moved to Dev Review
 This PR includes appropriate unit tests
 I have run and tested this change locally

commit.message: add helptext to notebooks, fix styles

nodes.bodyText: Please add a comment somewhere to explain what this is doing, or else rename property to be more clearly tied to the display implications per above comment

Is there a more semantic name that can be used here, e.g. "notebookFullscreenStyle" (or something similar - I don't follow the goal for the property). I'm not following how this relates to a router outlet.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -142,6 +142,9 @@ const routes: Routes = [
                       // use the (urldecoded) captured value nbName
                       pathElementForTitle: 'nbName',
                       breadcrumb: BreadcrumbType.Notebook,
+                      helpContent: 'notebookStorage',
+                      notebookHelpSidebarStyles: true,
+                      notebookRouterOutletContainerStyles: true,

nodes.bodyText: Perhaps this would be explained by the other comments, but why is the new property not set here?

                       pathElementForTitle: 'nbName',
                       breadcrumb: BreadcrumbType.Notebook,
-                      helpContent: 'preview',

nodes.bodyText:
OK I see what it's doing now. Maybe containerFullHeightOverride or contentFullHeightOverride?
Comment in workspace-wrapper wouldn't hurt as well to explain that it's needed primarily due to the notebooks page iframe
